body:
Hi!

Does any of you know a decent screen recorder I could use?

Thanks :)
body_tagged:
Hi!

Does any of you know a decent screen recorder I could use?

Thanks :)
title: Any Suggestions?

replies.body:
It depends on the computer you're running.

If you're using Mac,
Try Quicktime. It's a pre-installed program that should record your minecraft gameplay pretty well, that is if you're not already lagging in-game ;v

If you're using Windows
I recommend Fraps. It's a pretty smooth running software.
replies.body_tagged:
It depends on the computer you're running.

If you're using Mac,
Try Quicktime. It's a pre-installed program that should record your minecraft gameplay pretty well, that is if you're not already lagging in-game ;v

If you're using Windows
I recommend Fraps. It's a pretty smooth running software.

replies.body:
Ah ok
I will check out fraps.
Thanks
replies.body_tagged:
Ah ok
I will check out fraps.
Thanks

replies.body:
Fraps create Huge files. If you don't have a good computer I wouldn't recommend it.
You also have to buy it.

OBS on the other hand is free and I hear is quite good for recording.
Although I haven't had experience with OBS or Fraps myself, I have heard that OBS is quite good,

Don't get me wrong, Fraps is excellent. But unless you want to pay for it and have large files from the recording I personally would get OBS.

Bandicam is also another recording program but I personally ddon't know much about it.

But it's your choice :)

Here bud:
OBS: https://obsproject.com 
Fraps: http://www.fraps.com
Bandicam: http://www.bandicam.com

replies.body:
"I recommend Fraps. It's a pretty smooth running software."

hehehe if I start recording, my CPU goes up to 100% at 4ghz and my mouse is so laggy and the frames drop from 800 to 85...

(and yea, ofc the cpu fan is going crazy)
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Try to use "Action", better than Fraps in my opinion :)
replies.body_tagged: Try to use "Action", better than Fraps in my opinion :)

replies.body:
Ok no. If you run 800 fps you will not get below 500 with fraps... I have a Laptop running 300 fps and recording with fraps doesnt go below 100 -.-

I would recommend DxTory, its a VERY good recording software

  • 20 minute video doesnt take more than 100MB
  • FPS drop about 60
  • Quiality: Outstanding
  • However needs a LOT of experience of what recorders do to be able to run it correctly ._.
http://exkode.com/dxtory-downloads-en.html

replies.body:
Some people have great fps, but with certain programs such as FRAPS it can decrease immensely.
I would recommend using action! it's better and faster :P
